description:
What we love
With all the hallmarks of a forever family home, this engaging 4 bedroom Californian bungalow is absolutely timeless. Welcomed by a leadlight front door and charmed with all the period features, jarrah floorboards and picture rails, high ceilings, ceiling roses and original milk glass light features.
A sympathetic renovation has added generous living spaces and updated bathrooms, whilst still continuing the captivating period details.

This exquisite treasure also enjoys a year-round entertainer's alfresco and rear garden complete with an outdoor kitchen, Balinese style bale, beguiling swimming pool and established tropical, palm garden.


In a sea of layered tropical beauty, this 4 bedroom 1.5 bathroom brick and tile Californian Bungalow blends relaxed family harmony with poolside entertaining, positioned in the family friendly dream pocket, close to the city and the sea.

What we know
Set back from the deep verge and opposite Blackford Street Park this beautiful Californian Bungalow is nestled amongst establish palm trees.

The traditional front porch, a perfect place to watch the world go by, invites you through the first of many period charms, a leadlight front door opening into Jarrah timber floors which flow throughout the home, soaring ceilings, ceiling roses, Jarrah dado rails, milk glass light fixtures and fireplaces.

The bedrooms are perfectly positioned at the front of the home, creating private spaces from the main living and entertaining zones at the rear of the home.
All accentuate the stunning original detail whilst feature the modern comfort of air conditioning.

An updated, yet completely sympathetic, family bathroom services the front of the house and is dressed with brass fixtures, period style diamond accent tiles and pedestal basin.

The timber kitchen, modernised with white subway tiles, inter grated range hood and stainless-steel Miele appliances has space for a dining table for quick, casual meals.

Maintaining the perfect period details the extension to the home has well thought out modern practicalities.
The laundry, adjacent to the kitchen, continues the styling of the family wet area yet has included a WC for visitors, a shower for post pool rinse offs and direct access to the outside of the home.

A vast, yet welcoming living space feeds from the kitchen and informal meals through double leadlight glass doors.
The family sized living room also welcomes the period details of the cornices, ceiling roses and more leadlight windows. A purely contemporary space with classic character charms opening through oversized timber doors to the asset rich backyard.

The covered alfresco has the wonderful addition of the outdoor kitchen, which includes a plumbed sink and oversized BBQ cooking zone, all overlooking the enticing swimming pool.
Resort style living, at home.


The enviable outdoor set up is framed by established tropical style gardens and crowned with a double sized bale positioned at the top of the garden, allowing a private space outside, away from the entertainment precinct.

A charming classic 52 Blackford Street will please the entire family with its relaxed and roomy zoned living and substantial poolside entertaining in private tranquil surrounds, catering for endless summer barbeques with enough space to host a crowd, all year round.


Council: $1846.78 pa
Water: $1345.52pa


Location
180m to Transperth bus stop for Scarborough Beach Road
850m to family favourite Braithwaite Park, nature play area
1km to local favourite Humblebee coffee and Cabin Small bar

Schools
800m Mount Hawthorn Primary School
5.6km Bob Hawke College
(in catchment)

Who to talk to
Please connect with Chris Pham by calling 0448 777 511 or email cpham@realmark.com.au to secure your private viewing of this true Californian classic beauty.
